description: 8 lab experiments with pre-lab quizzes (20%) and post-lab proforma reports (80%). Requires analysis of results, discussion, and safety considerations. Best 6 of 8 labs counted. Includes hurdle requirement of attending ≥6 labs and scoring ≥50%.

Individual plan to solve an analytical chemistry problem using course techniques. Details experimental methods, sample preparation, data expectations, analysis processes, and dependencies. Developed through workshops and submitted in Week 10.
45-minute individual test in Week 5 assessing first 2 course topics. Includes multiple choice, short/long answer, and graphing questions. Forms part of hurdle requirement with final exam.

2-hour exam plus reading time during formal exam period. Tests theoretical understanding of course topics with multiple choice, short/long answer, and graphing questions. Forms part of hurdle requirement with mid-term test.
